review_text: Rough ride/stiff, major sway almost a roll over concern, design defect in air delivery system (verified by technician, numerous complaints)extremely noisy. Set delivery mode to floor, set fan to max and major force (plus noise) air against dash told single paddle (door) is problem. Actual MPG measured numerous times since purchase 20-25% below posted MPG on sticker. Cargo compartment has good depth, acceptable width but height makes loaded many items impossible, engine is also noisy. Disappointed in Honda and this 36,000 vehicle, expected better. Offered name and number to Honda on several surveys to discuss no response
label: neg

review_text: Vehicle: 2017 XLE 4dr SUV AWD (3.5L 6cyl 8AT 8 spd transmission) We purchased a new 2017 Highlander XLE after comparing it to several other vehicles in its class. Toyota touts quality and safety features as their biggest sales pitch, seems its there every time we turn on a tv. The transmission problem occurred at 8,253 miles, lucky for my wife, she was at a red light when the transmission failed and nobody was injured. The vehicle was hauled to local Toyota dealer on a flatbed & sat at the dealership for 52 days. We were told by dealer that a new transmission was back-ordered from California. After picking up the vehicle I noticed the work order stated part number 30510-48600-84 REMAN ATM and CORE RETURN. Re-manufactured parts should not be used to repair a brand new vehicle under factory warranty, which hasnt seen its first oil change. The day after picking it up I drove the vehicle around and excessive power train noise was present. Vehicle went back the the shop & they replaced both front wheel bearings at 8,392 miles and it sat in the shop another 3 days. Neither one of these repairs should occur on any new vehicle or a vehicle under 100,000 for that matter. Toyota Corporate has been less than helpful & were currently going through the lemon law process. Toyota has lost another long time customer, if I could rate the 2017 Highlander 0 stars I would.
label: neg

review_text: Everything in this car beeps -- too many gadgets -- not convenient for driver as far as storage, etc.
label: neg

review_text: The turbo engine in the EX and above models has a major problem. Fuel is getting into the oil. Oil level rises. This problem has been reported on 2016 - 2018 models but no fix yet. Im hopeful. Other than that, this is a great car, but I cant recommend it to others. Just do a web search
label: neg

review_text: 2017 Jeep Grand Cherokee Overland, 4x4, 5.7L Hemi, all available advanced safety technology. Had for 9 months, 20,000 miles. Decision factors: Real 4wd, flat cargo floor, advanced safety technology, wifi, big enough to put knees at point of impact in most crashes (I was an ER nurse.) and fast enough to be safe getting on highway. Had to be American brand. This is long, but I gained much from other reviews and hope my views help someone else. Considered: Another Tahoe; Jeep replacing 10+yo one that I dearly love, but lack of available flat cargo floor and rough ride sadly put new Tahoe out of running. Mercedes, loved it, was cheaper than Jeep, but insurance would have been 180 per month higher than Jeep. (Or my Corvette!!!) Insurance company said avoid, Porsche, Mercedes, Audi, Mini Cooper and Volvo as all would be high. Hated the BMW, nothing good to say about it. Liked the Murano, but lack of 4WD made me take off short list. Initially did not consider FCJ products due to horrible J.D. Powers quality rating, but after extensive research, on sites like this, I found the GC was not a problem vehicle. I expressed my concern to dealer and I bought a bumper to bumper 100K after-market warranty for a lot less than Chevy sells one. I am not a fan of these warranties, and know they are usually not a good investment, but this one was very reasonable, and from an insurance company I have known of. Hope I dont regret it, but got me over my fears of this brand. (Read update below.) Pros. Advanced safety technology is awesome. Cheap insurance costs. Adjustable ride height is great, because I am short and makes getting in easy. Hemi in sport mode is really fun; just dont look at gas gage. Very nimble, short turning radius makes it very nice in tight parking garages which I have to traverse daily. Flat cornering with very little body roll. Panoramic moon roof makes interior feel larger. Initial fit and finish very good. Overall nice manners, nothing in drive-ability I would change. Controls familiar and easy to use. Good rear visibility even with headrests up. Heated steering wheel great, didnt think needed but really enjoying. Flat cargo floor. Excellent rear camera. Ventilated seats. Cargo area good size for big dog. Cons. Uncomfortable seats. (Seems to be a trend, and all but the Murano had these hard seats.) Gas mileage, I am not using eco mode. (Gas mileage climbing, after 3,000 miles up to 21mpg in mixed driving.) Wants mid-grade fuel. U-Connect; after 4 different techs, finally got iPhone 6s linked, but multiple phones a nightmare. Doesnt consistently work, and sometimes hangs up on callers it doesnt answer when using phone alone when in car. Cant text, cant use voice commands. Tech said not compatible with latest iOS, but were hopeful there would be upgrade soon. (REALLY? Considering the demographics of a GC buyer this is inexcusable. This is the primary reason for my lower overall rating and if I had known how bad it is, since this is my office, I might have chosen another vehicle.) Do not believe CNET review. U-Connect is horrible. Wifi through Sprint; was advised it wasnt very good by tech support and couldnt do what I needed because even with unlimited data it is only 3G and poor coverage. (? Think, know is a lower level service.) Told 2017 GC wasnt compatible with Pandora, even though has app, and after tech support couldnt make work, I was able to make work. Our Chevy is through t-Mobile and as good as TWC at home but does have data limits. Chevys My Link is far better and easier to use. I wish I had bought the stereo upgrade, like Bose in Chevys which is MUCH better. Wish had more ports for auxiliary equipment. Bad blind spot created by driver side A pillar and mirror. Carpet looks cheap. Rear hatch should be operated electrically, and advised not to shut manually, which took some training to get the dog to stay back while it slowly closes, and it doesnt always work. (It is having some issues, but dont know if it is the dogs bed pushing on it or something else I have on the floor causing this.) In conclusion: I am into cars, and wish I was more excited about this very expensive vehicle, but when I am asked how I like it, I respond its growing on me, probably partly due to my expectations. I have to remind myself this is a tool for my job and was the logical choice for me at this time. My vehicle is my office and I have to be able to get to see patients regardless of conditions. Even though very expensive, in my book, it doesnt scream you have money, so if you are looking for prestige, this isnt your vehicle, which is good in my line of work. If you are considering this vehicle, when you test drive it make sure you test it in regular, eco and sport mode. It is three different vehicles. I found out when took delivery of my ordered vehicle it was in regular mode, but I had test drove demo in sport mode. When I changed mode to sport, I was much happier; throatier exhaust notes and throw you back in the seat acceleration. (I did the adult thing and switched back to regular mode when I saw effect on gas-mileage.) Even if the GC is not your final choice, please consider getting a vehicle with advanced safety technology. We are so sold on it after only two months we are considering trading my husbands near new Silverado for one with the technology, we feel it is that important. It does take some getting used to, like trying to get through a skinny ATM lane, but has proven very valuable already. Hope it will be mandatory on all cars in a few years. Update: After 9 months of fighting with FCA about iphone to Uconnect problem, I am trading the vehicle. They just dont care and have admitted iphone isnt compatible with Uconnect even though they advertise it is. My car is my office so this is critical for my productivity.
label: neg

review_text: The 2017 Touring is our 2nd Pilot and has been a big disappointment. The underpowered engine has a tough time accelerating into traffic and the new 9-speed transmission hard-shifts instead of a smooth and seamless shift, jerking passengers in the car. There is an embarrassing and annoying rattle in the left front that the dealership cant seem to figure out and another one coming from the steering. I feel like an idiot having paid what I did for this tin can of a car.

review_text: I had owned 2003 honda CRV=constint repair vehecal was 6years old with 90k on it when I purchased it and had current recalls on it air bag in stering wheel electrical for wipers and electrical switches for window, also had reverse selenoid in transmission go bad, air conditioning system replaced 2 times, front breaks pads and rotors and rear breaks pads,cailpers and rotors, all window actuaters= motors, in 4.5 years cost of repairs was over 8000.00 so reliablity doesnt seam to be a priority for this vehical, have other american vehicals with much less cost to repair and more reliabilty, do extensive amount of reasearch before you purchase a vehical, hopefully you will find something you like that is reliable.

review_text: This is a nice car I like the looks of it. The ride is good a little on the hard side but it handles good because of it. Visibility is very good much better then the other SUVs I tried. The interior is very roomy and the seats are supportive. You set up high In the seats that helps with the visibility. The rear seats are comfortable but they dont fold all the way to front seats and dont fold as easy as my CRV. The car has good power for a 2.5 better then my CRV. And the CVT is much better then I expected it does take time to get used to. Gas mileage is good 29 to 30 on the highway and about 19 to 22 in town. I really wanted to like this car but the quality of the paint was very poor. Subaru customer service was a nightmare to work with.

review_text: The short block was replaced at approx 18K miles because it failed the oil consumption test (bad rings- Subaru extended warranty to 100K for oil consumption issues). There was a grinding noise on cold start-up attributed to excessive rod clearance. Due to this issue, the short block was replaced again at approx 20K miles. The grinding noise continued. The short block was replaced again at approx 22K miles. Noise went away. At the next oil change (28K miles), the oil level was right near the top of the dipstick. At the second oil change (34K miles), oil was down 1/2 quart. I expect to fail oil consumption test shortly and need another short block. Any ideas about how to dispose of this vehicle other than lemon law?
label: neg

review_text: Its a beautiful, well designed car with lots of features more expensive cars have and its been perfect for 3 years (bought 2014 Altitude new) and once the warranty runs out at 3 years the issues start. Trade in value is 50% of what I paid new 3 years ago at same dealership.

review_text: I purchased my 2017 Honda CRV Touring AWD in June 2017. The day I went to take delivery the salesman was doing his walk around with me and showing me how to operate the car. They were all ready to let me drive off the lot when I pointed out that the drivers seat bolster was malformed and deflated. The mechanic comes out and says they never saw anything like that. So I take the car home and make an appointment to drop it off so they can disassemble the seat to find out what is wrong. After 3 days they get the parts and put the seat back together. I go to pick it up. They seat is ok. Not perfect and the nice tan leather interior is covered in black greasy hand prints. So they bring another guy out to clean it. Which should have been done before I even got there. Fast forward 6 months and it is time for the 5000 mile check up and oil change. I tell them I have been hearing lifter noises and a strange whining from the transmission. After an hour in the waiting room they take me out to the garage to show me the underneath of new car covered in some kind of fluid that is leaking from somewhere under the motor. They dont know what kind of fluid it is. So I have to leave my car while they try to figure out what is wrong with it. A week later I get a call saying they think it is oil and it is the rear main seal. They tell me it was probably like that since my last change, at which time I point out that this is the first oil change on my new car so they say it was probably installed wrong at the factory and has been leaking like that since I got it new off the lot. They also tell me they dont know what they sounds are that I was hearing. So I guess I was hearing things! 3 weeks later they finally have the car back together and are going to drive it for 50 miles and make sure that there is no more leak. I opened up a case with Honda Motor Corp. because I have serious doubts about the reliability of this vehicle since it has been like this since the factory how do I know what kind of damage it has suffered internally? They mechanics say they didnt see any metal chips in the oil but I still dont trust them. I will be getting rid of this car. I dont trust. Honda Quality has gone right done the toilet.
label: neg

review_text: This car lacks in room, functionality, and layout. I cant wait to get out of this lease!!!! It is the most uncomfortablea car I have ever owned!!!! I want my HONDA back. Very dissapointed that I paid for features like a 3rd row leather seat that is so small a small child complains when they sit back there. The electronics have done nothing but give me problems from day 1!!! i have lost allof my phone contacts and all of my addresses that I had saved in the GPS.

review_text: First during this first year the transmission went out. Since it was under warranty it was fixed. Then the air conditioning compressor stopped working and I also couldnt start the truck. The warranty paid for the repairs. Now the horn goes on by itself. I had to remove a fuse to shut the horn off. Im going to trade in this piece of junk and get me a Toyota Highlander instead. I had a Highlander before and I drove the car 7 years 157,000 miles with no problems.

review_text: Never thought I would ever say Do not buy the Honda Pilot, but I must. Frequent, but random "Hard Shift" issues with the transmission. 3 times to the dealer and no solution. It has been the worst new car experience in my 58 years.. The random nature of the issue is making honda think we are imagining the problem because they cannot duplicate.. There is a big issue with this car. Still not resolved.. Stay away till they figure out there problem.
label: neg

review_text: I've bought many Hondas since 1984, mostly Accords and Odysseys, all with bullet-proof reliability, comfort and handling. I decided to treat myself to a new, 2016 Pilot Touring AWD, now that the kids are grown. This is the most comfortable and quiet Honda I've ever owned. That's all the good I can say. The rest is either fair to poor. Handling on curves is somewhat cumbersome. The 9-speed transmission is slow to react to driver demands. If you approach a car on a curve on a 2-lane road, the car senses and flashes an imminent collision. The hood of the car flutters like a flag on a windy day when at highway speeds. The automatic cruise control is good at slowing down and braking when a car jumps in front of you, but recovery to set speed is very slow. The Infotainment system is too complicated to operate and voice commands are recognized only about 50% of the time. The Garmin navigation is excellent though. Last, but not least, reliability is poor in extreme cold. Getting out of work the evening of 12/18/16, the outside air temperature was -15 degrees. My brand-new Pilot stranded me by refusing to start. The engine didn't turn over at all. The next day I called the dealer, he said it was most likely a bad battery and would be replaced. On 12/20/16, I went to go get my Pilot with jumper cables in hand. It was + 25 degrees outside. I decided to try to start it one more time before using jumper cables, and it started immediately. The battery was later tested at the dealer, and the dealer said the battery was fine, with no other explanation of why my new Pilot didn't start at -15 degrees, while every other one of my coworker’s vehicles started with no issues. So sad, no more Hondas for me.
label: neg

review_text: This 9 speed transmission is horrible. I have had it in the shop SIX times for factory updates, resets and adjustments. CLONKS and jerks into 5th gear, and slips into 1st and 2nd gear. DO NOT BUY THIS JEEP! Google the Cherokee and see if you like the feedback.
label: neg

review_text: I have only owned this vehicle for 2months, It rides like a tank, you fell absolutely every defect or bump in the road. It is the most uncomfortable vehicle we have ever owned. The Jeep looks good, dont buy the 4Cyl it has no get up and go! Why bother making it a 4wheel drive. My old Grand Cherokee from 1995 rode better than this. Worst buy every and now I am upside down over 10,000.:( :(

review_text: 6 weeks into ownership - stranded by a dead battery. Dealer says bad battery, I say something killed it, and am waiting for it to happen again. Many rattles in the interior, clunking noise from the front end. Overall, very disappointing, especially for paying extra vs other models for Honda reliability. Ugh. I do not recommend, and I will be looking to get rid of this lemon come springtime, if it makes it that long.
label: neg

review_text: As said in the other reviews, the infotainment system doesn't work and the voice commands are very frustrating and dangerous to use. Honda refuses to update the infotainment system with Android Auto. My 2016 Honda Pilot EX-L with 4WD and Honda Sensing cost $40,000 and does not have a CD player or NAV, and in retrospect it unfortunately is not a good value. I like the six speed transmission, and Honda Sensing has already paid for itself by preventing two accidents. But after yelling at the voice commands for a year my wife wanted me to trade in the Pilot on a Toyota Highlander. The dealer only offered me $30,000 for the Honda, so I guess I'm stuck with it. Woof! It's a dog. Do yourself a favor and buy a Toyota Highlander instead, it has a nicer interior, drives almost as well and has an easy to use infotainment system.

review_text: Actually the dealership has been great, my problem is that Chrysler has not stood behind the product. I purchased the 2012 Grand Cherokee Overland model with the leather interior. The seam stitching split on the dash by the windshield and I took it in and was informed by the manufacturer representative that they would not take care of it. This was about a year and a 1/2 ago and the vehicle had about 29,000 miles on it. This is a one owner vehicle that has always been garaged and cared for the entire time. For the record, until Chrysler steps up and stands behind the product, I will not entertain any Chrysler products, including when I replace my Chrysler Mercedes SL550. It really is a shame! A simple solution and no one has the ability to resolve it.

review_text: I have been driving this SUV almost one year. I thought it was best car for me. Spent lot of money. but I am disappointed because of AWD system performs in offroad tests as it was one of the worst performers. I've been loyal to Toyota for many years and now I am really disappointed. searing wheel is not comfortable at all for long drive. interior accessories is very low quality. AWD performance is not good enough. side view mirror is not balance with driving seat. most of the time I can not see while I try to turn left or right. review_text: I test drove the newest Highlander and other crossover SUVs in the segment was not impressed. I went in very excited and considered the Highlander to be a favorite going in but it was very disappointing. The car itself felt cheap compared to others in the segment and wasn't as smooth a ride. The space was underwhelming as well, especially in the 3rd row. I like the front end style of the car but a couple of angles looked kind of minivan-ish. Was also disappointed seeing how poor the Highlander's AWD system performs in offroad tests as it was one of the worst performers on Fast Lane's test up Gold Mine Hill. I've been loyal to Toyota for many years but I think it's time to consider other options.

review_text: Check out the Piloteers web site. Car is roomy and has a decent ride. Computer overestimates the MPG for some unknown reason. The touch screen is a joke. Not worth it. The FM reception is horrible and Honda won't fix it. Can not recommend this car.

review_text: I hate my 2015 Jeep Cherokee Sport. I bought it almost two years ago and 36,000 miles later, it is worth much less than half of what I bought it for. Within 6 months it started giving me problems. Oil consumption which ended up in an engine replacement at 11,000 miles, after taking the car to the dealer numerous times for repair. Then started the transmission noises and roughness. Software updates and transmission failure. I have always loved Jeeps and was finally in a position to buy my very own. I will never buy another Jeep again. It looks beautiful but it is definitely not worth it. No consolation is the fact that my 3 yr warranty has expired and I still have 4 years of payments left, and praying nothing else goes wrong with it.

review_text: It was bad enough that my brand new Grand Cherokee was leaking oil as soon as I brought it home (which ended up needing a full axle replacement). Now the transmission is having problems over and over again at only 6,000 miles. Shifting is horrible and out of sync. I don't even like driving it and can't wait to get a different vehicle. I should have stuck with Ford. Had my F-150 for 4 years and not a single problem.

review_text: I have had to replace the plastic skid plate, broke the first time I was off road, the seat belt,the power window, the gas cover and now the transmission. Only the transmission covered by the warranty. The tires are weak and constantly flat so I had to buy smaller wheels and 10 ply tires. the car has the worst navigation system ever. I will never buy another jeep.
